Activity

mtcdb.dataset.activity [module]

Class representing data structures for the neuronal activity.

Classes

mtcdb.datasets.activity.RawSpikes

Raw data for one unit in one recording session.

Firing rates for one unit in all the trials of all its recording sessions.

class RawSpikes(unit_id, session_id, sampling_rate=25000)[source]

Bases: DataHandler

Raw data for one unit in one recording session.

For each unit (neuron), raw data consists in its spiking times during all the trials of one recording session.

Each spiking time (in seconds) is relative to the beginning of the trial in which is occured (i.e. time origin is resetted at 0 in each trial).

Parameters:

  • unit_id (str) –

  • session_id (str) –

  • sampling_rate (float) –

unit_id

Unit’s identifier.

Type:

str

session_id

Session’s identifier.

Type:

str

spikes

Spiking times for the unit in the session (in seconds). Times restart from 0 in each trial.

Type:

NDArray[np.float64]

trials

Trial indexes corresponding to spiking times (i.e. each time is associated with the the index of the trial in which it occurred). Stored in ascending order, from 1 to the number of trials in the session, with contiguous duplicates (e.g. 1111122223333...).

Type:

NDArray[np.int64]

n_trials

Number of trials in the session.

Type:

int

sampling_rate

Sampling time for the recording, in seconds.

Type:

float

path_data

Directory where the data files of the unit are stored.

Type:

str

get_path()[source]

Construct the path for the data file.

Return type:

str

Warning

Trial indices start at 1, not 0 (in contrast to Python indexing).

See also

DataHandler

Mixin class for handling data files.

__init__(unit_id, session_id, sampling_rate=25000)[source]

Constructor - Instantiate a RawSession object for one unit in one recording session.

Load the raw data (if possible) and set its basic properties.

Parameters:

  • session_id (str) –

  • sampling_rate (float) – Default: mtcdb.constants.SMPL_RATE

get_path()[source]

Construct the path for the data file.

Return type:

str

load()[source]

Load the raw data from a .npy file, if possible.

Returns:

  • spikes (NDArray[np.float64]) – Spiking times for the unit in the session.

  • trials (NDArray[np.int64]) – Trial numbers associated with each spike.

Return type:

Tuple[ndarray[Any, dtype[float64]], ndarray[Any, dtype[int64]]]

Notes

The raw data of one neuron in one session is stored in a ndarray of floats with shape (2, nspikes) under the format [[trial numbers], [spiking times]]. data[1] : Spiking times. data[0] : Trial numbers associated with each spike. In this initial array, trial indices are stored under type float, because of the constrained homogeneous types in numpy arrays. Here they are converted to integers.

Warning

This method overrides the load method of the base class DataHandler.

See also

DataHandler.load

Load data from a file.

class FiringRates(unit_id, tbin=0.05, smooth_window=0.1)[source]

Bases: object

Firing rates for one unit in all the trials of all its recording sessions.

Parameters:

  • unit_id (str) –

  • tbin (float) –

  • smooth_window (float) –

unit_id

Unit’s identifier.

Type:

str

sessions

All the session identifiers.

Type:

List[str]

data

Firing rates for the unit in all the trials of all its recording sessions. Shape: (n_tpts, n_trials).

Type:

NDArray[np.float64]

n_trials

Total number of trials across all the sessions.

Type:

int

n_tpts

Number of time points in a trial’s time course.

Type:

int

tmax

Total duration the firing rate time course.

Type:

float

t_on, t_off

Times of the stimulus onset and offset.

Type:

float

tbin

Time bin for the firing rate time course.

Type:

float

smooth_window

Smoothing window size (in seconds).

Type:

float

path_data

Directory where the data files of the unit are stored.

Type:

str

See also

DataHandler

Mixin class for handling data files.

xr.DataArray

N-dimensional labeled array.

Notes

This class is a wrapper around a xarray.DataArray object, which is used to store the firing rates for one unit in all the trials. The data is saved in a netCDF file, with the following dimensions: - time: time points in the trial’s time course. - trial: trial indexes. Accessing coordinates or methods specific to DataArray becomes straightforward, without compromising the original structure or requiring additional method calls.

__init__(unit_id, tbin=0.05, smooth_window=0.1)[source]

Constructor - Instantiate a FiringRates object for one unit.

Two ways to instantiate a FiringRates object, depending on the arguments provided to the consturctor:

  1. Only the arguments required for the path. No data. Then, data will be loaded from an existing .nc file (previously computed during preprocessing). All the properties will be recovered from this object.

  2. If a data set is provided, Create an object from its basic properties, to save data for the first time.

This class serves as an interface to save and retrieve data.

Parameters:

  • unit_id (str) –

  • tbin (float) – Time bin for the firing rate time course.

  • smooth_window (float) – Smoothing window size (in seconds).

get_path()[source]

Construct the path for the data file in netCDF format.

Return type:

str
